description.narrative: The objectives of the Project are to: (i) provide additional rail transport capacity, improved service quality and higher freight throughput on the Khurja to Mughalsarai section of the Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor; and (ii) develop Institutional capacity of DFCCIL to build, maintain and operate the entire dedicated freight corridor network.

participating-org.narrative: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Ltd.
Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, Republic of India
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual GAAP Progress Report | Description :DFCCIL to prepare annual progress reports on the implementation ofthe GAAP. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Contractors compliance with Safeguard Documents | Description :DFCCIL to ensure that the contracts for civilworks include the obligation of the relevant contractor to comply with the relevant Safeguard documents applicable to such civilworks. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Final Impact Study | Description :DFCCIL to provide to the Bank a final impact study of the Project, conductedunder terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :31-Dec-2020

Finance Agreement :Governmental Permits & Resettlement Measures/Compensation | Description :DFCCIL to ensure that all associated tocertain civil works: (i) governmental permits and clearances have been obtained, and any conditions for such permits met/fulfilled;and (ii) all resettlement measures (including compensation to Project Affected Persons ) have been carried out, prior todisplacement and/or the provision of relocation assistance to all displaced persons. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redressal Mechanism | Description :DFCCIL to maintain a two stage grievance redressal committee atdistrict level and headquarters, and an ombudsman to handle/processany complaints arising out of the implementation of the RPF andthe RAP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Reviews of Safeguard Documents | Description :DFCCIL to undertake annual reviews and preparereports on the results obtained and experiences gained in the implementation of the RAPs; and implement adjustments to the RAPs andRPF as per the recommendations made by the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Ineligible Expenditures (negative list) | Description :DFCCIL shall ensure that the proceeds of the Loan are notutilized to finance land acquisition or to pay any compensation for resettlement and rehabilitation of displaced persons under theProject. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Partial/Phased Plan for Signaling and Telecommunications Systems | Description :DFCCIL to agree: (i) with therespective contractor carrying out the railway track construction, on a partial/phased plan for the installation of signaling,telecommunications and electrical system; and (ii) with the respective authorities and/or relevant utilities, on an interconnectionand/or utilities relocation plan. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Documents | Description :DFCCIL to implement the project in accordance with the Project ImplementationManual, the Concession Agreement, the Track Access Agreement, the Safeguard Documents and the GAAP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Management Consultant (PMC) | Description :DFCCIL to select and engage the services of a PMC in order toassist with contract management functions for the design-build contracts, and the general implementation of the project. | Due Date:31-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Quality and Safety Audit Consultant (QSAC) & SESMRC | Description :DFCCIL to select and engage the services of aQSAC and SESMRC in order to prepare quarterly monitoring reports on the implementation of the civil works and compliance with theSafeguard Documents | Due Date :31-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Documents | Description :DFCCIL to implement the Project in accordance with the Safeguard Documents(i.e. EMF, RPF, EIAs, EMPs, SIAs, and RAPs), and to refrain from unilaterally amending, suspending, voicing or waiving anyprovision of said documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Social and Environmental Management Unit | Description :DFCCIL to maintain the Social & Environmental ManagementUnit with adequate staff in headquarters and field offices for ensuring compliance with, and the implementation of, social andenvironmental safeguards measures/documents | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Track Access Regime | Description :DFCCIL to ensure that the track access charge regime is in place andoperational prior to commencement of commercial operations of the EDFC. | Due Date :31-Dec-2017

title.narrative: Additional freight train paths on EDFC
Assessment of alternative approaches to non-discriminatory access and development of a methodology for establishing track access charges
Study on energy optimization options for the dedicated freight corridor
Study to analyze and understand different safety related aspects of the DFC program and their implementation
Study on heavy haul wagons specifications and procurement

actual.value: Regular induction of Wagon is in Progress. Total more than 2500 wagons inducted. Tender for Electric loco under finalization inRailway Board.

title.narrative: Freight traffic carried on the EDFC
